word: G5537 - χρηματίζω - chrēmatízō - khray-mat-id'-zo - Be called

sections.paragraph: 1. to transact business, to manage public affairs
2. to give a response to those consulting an oracle
3. to assume or take to oneself a name from one's public business

ஆங்கில மூலம் / Original in English: From G5536; to utter an oracle (compare the original sense of G5530), that is, divinely intimate; by implication (compare the secular sense of G5532) to constitute a firm for business, that is, (genitive) bear as a title: - be called, be admonished (warned) of God, reveal, speak.
Cognate: G5536, G5537, G5538
